body_content.explanation: a series of germ cells (= sperm or egg cells) that develop from earlier cells, containing genetic material that can be passed on, or the genetic material itself:
examples: There will be people who want to be the first to successfully modify a human germline.
These breast cancer susceptibility genes are commonly mutated in the germline of 5-10% of all breast cancer cases.
Meiosis begins with the germ line cells, which are diploid.
The disease is associated with germ-line mutations.
